rdfs:label: Jako
ns:common.topic.description: The Jako programming language for the Parrot virtual machine was initially created by Gregor N. Purdy as a \"user-friendly mini-language,\" and became the first Parrot-targeted language implementation to have subroutines. It is similar to Java (programming language) or C++, but makes several large deviations, in some ways making it closer to Perl. Jako can be compiled into Parrot's assembly language, PASM, and then run on the Parrot virtual machine.\nHello world in Jako is:

ns:common.document.text: Jako, much more commonly referred to as \"Jakk\", is a programming language created by Gary Niger. It is similar to Scheme, but makes several large deviations, in some ways making it closer to Ruby. Jakk can be compiled with GHC and with emacs. Hello world in Jakk is:\n~!OUTPUT> .:HELLO WORLD:. .;NEWLINE;. AND .|.DIE;;

ns:type.object.name: Jako
